bug.author: karriebear
bug.summary: Documentation - API should not list element as a parameter.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/en/stable/api.html>API</denchmark-link> should not list element as a parameter. This is happening on all the components in the API. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Go to
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
For example, streamlit.text should be as follows <denchmark-code>streamlit.text(body) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>streamlit.text(element, body) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Yes

comments.comment:
Interesting. The suggestion here is to manually specify the arguments, which seems sub-optimal: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/a/30584552/2394542>https://stackoverflow.com/a/30584552/2394542</denchmark-link>
Thinking I might try the other suggestion of having a function do this, to avoid the documentation getting stale if new parameters are added: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/a/30629191/2394542>https://stackoverflow.com/a/30629191/2394542</denchmark-link>

Opps should have probably included but <denchmark-link:https://github.com/akrolsmir>@akrolsmir</denchmark-link> is refactoring which seems to address this automatically as a by product. Issue created for tracking just to make sure we're good for our next release :) Didn't even think to look at how sphinx is doing it. I think if we still encounter issues after the DG changes, we can take a closer look.
